info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 02 at 10:40PM EST until February 04 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of one tenth to one half of an inch possible. * WHERE...In Pennsylvania, Southern Wayne, Pike, Lackawanna, Luzerne and Wyoming counties. In New York, Sullivan county. * WHEN...From Thursday evening through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Scattered rain and a few snow showers are possible overnight, changing to all rain by Thursday morning. A cold front will move in from the north, changing rain to a mix of freezing rain and sleet, and eventually some snow Thursday evening into Friday. Considerable uncertainty remains in how far south the colder air will move in, and sleet may develop at the expense of freezing rain. * PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
